data.title: Opensuse 13.2 - Atom - Can't open remote folder (project) and right click menu not existing
data.body:
When I attempt to open using atom a remote network folder using terminal:

atom smb://sambashare/..../folder

it open a new atom window with the current folder opened but no files in it..
anyone has an idea on how to get the right context menu available in opensuse kde 13.2?
I also have problem with remote folders using vpn or smb and remote file edit, it seems the file is saved in kde cache but when I change it, nothing prompt to upload the remote one..
I use atom in windows too and there aren't this problems.. thanks in advance

(atom version 1.2.0)

data.title: Add opened files and folders to recent documents menu
data.body: Title says it all! Closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3935

data.title: Portable 1.3b0 on Windows uses sibling folder for config
data.body:
When using the new --portable command line param, my .atom folder is moved to be a sibling of my Atom folder.  I was expecting to see .atom appear within that folder (as a sibling to the executable) and it took me a while to figure out why I didn't see it there.

Would it be possible to make that change?  I think a lot of folks take 'portable' to mean that they can drag a single folder to a new destination and a hidden sibling folder complicates that.

data.title: Close empty active window when Close command is given
data.body:
On OS X, Command-W is expected to close the current window, unless the current window has tabs (Safari, Chrome, Finder), in which case it will close the current tab, until only one is left, in which case it closes the entire window (and thus also the tab).

Currently in Atom, Command-W will close every pane item in the current pane, then the current pane, and so on until every pane is empty, which makes sense since pane items and panes ~ tabs. However, when only the empty root pane is left, which the user experiences as there being no panes left at all, hitting Command-W will not close the window, but will instead have no effect at all. To actually close the window, one needs to either manually hit the red close button in the upper left corner or the window, choose "Close Window" in the File menu or use the Cmd-Shift-W shortcut, all of which break the OS X UX contract.

With this PR, Command-W will behave exactly as it does right now, with one exception: when only the root pane is left, Command-W closes the entire window.

Hitting Command-W with only one pane item ~ tab open will NOT close the window, which is inconsistent with tabbed web browsing but makes more sense for a text editor.

data.title: Add OS X dock menu with 'New Window' option
data.body: I was getting annoyed by Atom missing this common OS X feature. It's especially useful when you have multiple spaces (desktops) with Atom already active on a different one than you are on currently. Currently, getting a new Atom window in this space takes 5 steps: 1. Click the dock icon, which would move you to the other space where Atom was already active 2. Choose "New Window" in the File menu (or use the Command+Shift+N shortcut) 3. Toggle Mission Control by hitting F3 or swiping up with the configured number of fingers 4. Drag the Atom window from the current space to the one where you wanted it 5. Switch back to the space you were on originally Now, it only takes 2: 1. Right-click the Atom icon 2. Choose "New Window"

Same problem.

data.title: List of Atom windows is missing on mac
data.body:
The `Window` menu item doesn't display the open Atom windows on OS X. I think this feature was present in previous versions.

I'm using Atom 1.2.0 on OS X 10.11.1.

data.title: Privacy policy must disclose the use of Google Analytics
data.body:
As stated in the [FAQ](https://atom.io/faq) page, Atom uses Google Analytics to provide useful feedback to the development team. I see from issue #4966 that work has started on providing a way for users to give informed consent, which is great.

Google Analytics' [Terms and Conditions](https://www.google.com/analytics/terms/us.html) under section 7 "Privacy" read: _"You must post a Privacy Policy and that Privacy Policy must provide notice of Your use of cookies that are used to collect data. You must disclose the use of Google Analytics, and how it collects and processes data."_

This is currently missing from your privacy policy and must be added to be compliant with Google's T&Cs, whether a method to opt-in (or out) is later added.

It's acceptable to use Google Analytics, you just have to disclose that you use it in a Privacy Policy.

data.title: Package-defined deserialization is broken (Atom-1.2.0)
data.body:
I was running into this with my own package, but it can be reproduced with the `release-notes` package by:
1. open a directory as a project (`atom .`)
2. open the developer console
3. show the release notes (⌘⇧P Release Notes: Show)
4. reload (View → Reload)
5. observe the following error:

```
No deserializer found for Object {deserializer: "ReleaseNotesView", uri: "atom://release-notes", releaseNotes: Array[23], releaseVersion: "1.1.0"}
```

(Note: when first loaded, it's displaying the release notes from 1.1.0, which is presumably unrelated.)

Possibly related to #9598

data.title: Problem with opening file in OS X and shortcut Go to directory
data.body:
I can't use my favorite shortchut in OS X (10.11 El Capitan). The Atom's version is 1.2.0. 
I have a french keyboard (AZERTY one)

I copy a file path with the finder. Let's say /Users/john
- i want to open a file in Atom : Cmd-O
- a finder-like windows appears. i want to go through a directory with the shortcut Cmd-Shift-G
- i can't paste the path /Users/john what is not the expected behavior

!**Installed packages:**
I have no addtionnal package installed. 
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes on 2 devices
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Yes

data.title: upgrade semver
data.body:
Upgrade semver to newest version!

It only has small changes and no significant API changes!

But it has an new license, from BSD to ISC!

See: [changes](https://github.com/npm/node-semver/compare/v4.3.3...v5.0.3)

data.title: Atom cause issues in files when switching between branches of a git repository
data.body:
When switching between branches of a git repository and a file is open in current branch that does not exists in switched branch, because that file does not exists in switched branch when closing that file Atom wants to save it, and when I leave it without saving after switching later branch that has those files I saw that those files content lost!
For more information please note that you have branches "branch_a", and "branch_b" that "branch_a" has file "file_a" but "branch_b" has not "file_a", if you open "file_a" in "branch_a" and after checkout to "branch_b" and "file_a" is open in atom editor because "file_a" does not exists in "branch_b" when I want to close that file "file_a" Atom wants to save that and when I leave it without saving when I come back to "branch_a" saw that "file_a" content lost!

My system is : Ubuntu 14.4 x86_64 with Atom 1.1 installed on it.

data.title: Cannot drag file to atom window to display it on linux
data.body: I' m using KDE 5 and atom 1.2.0 on archlinux. If I drag a text file from dolphin to atom window, there is no effect, while usually other text editors would display the text file when dragged into the window. Atom on OSX also supports this function. Is this not available on linux because of https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3593 ?

data.title: Add apm.cmd
data.body:
Allows Windows users who build Atom to conveniently type `apm` in the console just as they would for `atom`.

/cc @raelyard @joefitzgerald @kevinsawicki

data.title: Atom 1.2.0 crashes when closing a full-screen window on OS X 10.11.1
data.body:
To reproduce:
1. Run `atom --safe`
2. Make the window full-screen
3. Tap `⌘-Shift-W` to close the window
4. Wait for the crash!

Happy to share a full dump if needed. The more interesting bits:

data.title: Install fails on Win10
data.body: ---> (Inner Exception #0) System.IO.PathTooLongException: The specified path, file name, or both are too long. The fully qualified file name must be less than 260 characters, and the directory name must be less than 248 characters.

data.title: atom 1.2, 1.3-beta does not respect themes scrollbar styling on load
data.body:
When starting Atom in a directory where you currently had files open the scrollbars are loaded in each pane without any theme styling. If you then open a new file in that pane the scrollbars styles will be properly applied.

1.1 is OK.
OS: Ubuntu 14.04

data.title: Uncaught Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, lstat '/Users/username/Library/Application Sup...
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. Open Atom
2. Close Atom

**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.1
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
